law.catch_line: Conflicting amendments -- Last enactment to prevail.
law.text: In the event of a conflict between measures amending the same section of statutes, the one which passes the General Assembly last shall prevail. For purposes of codification only, a House bill shall be deemed to have passed the General Assembly when signed by the President of the Senate and a Senate bill shall be deemed to have passed the General Assembly when signed by the Speaker of the House of Representatives.
law.history: Created 1982 Ky. Acts ch. 2, sec. 1, effective February 5, 1982.
